reply: Well...for me...my family has served since before the American Revolution. I have two sons, both active duty, one currently deployed to Iraq, first deployment, the other just returned from his second deployment. Mainly though, because I cherish the freedoms that they have given us all.
title: Why do Americans worship the troops?

content: Maybe because you wouldn't have the freedom to come here and ask such an insultingly pointed question of the very men and women that provide you that freedom? Maybe because the world is not under German rule, executing everyone not white, blue haired and blond eyed? Maybe it's because we volunteer to defend the nation for $20k a year so young punks can suck the parent teet for their college degree to earn $100k a year and treat their employees like crap? Yup. We're just government employees. What an amazingly awesome observation! It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
reply: Maybe because you wouldn't have the freedom to come here and ask such an insultingly pointed question of the very men and women that provide you that freedom?
